intro: Mesembryanthemum knolfonteinense, commonly known as the Knolfontein mesem, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are thick and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum knolfonteinense is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
